PAGE.TITLE: Inclusion-exclusion principle
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
In combinatorics the inclusion exclusion principle is a couting technique which allows
you to determine the cardinality of the union of two finite sets. For two sets the
inclusion-exclusion principle states:
$$
| A \cup B | = |A| + |B| - | A \cup B |
$$
Where $A$ and $B$ are sets and the vertical lines tell us that we are taking the cardinality
of these sets. The cardinality is the number of elements in the set.

UL.LI: You should be able to state the inclusion exclusion principle.
You should be able to explain the derivation of the inclusion exclusion principle using Venn diagrams.
You should be able to explain how the inclusion exclusion principle can be used to calculate probabilities such as $P(X=1 \vee Y=1)$
